answers.answer: Wouldn't they have heard another hearbeat??  I doubt it...aren't you too far along?

I'm 21wks and no. A Lot of times they can't distinguish between two heart beats. I would imagine they would have caught it by now. Guess There must be another explanation for all the goofy things going on. Hopefully nothing bad though.
they would have seen the two babies on the us.

I have too much amniotic fluid too.  They said I might have gestational diabetes because thats one sign of it.  I passed my test so I don't know what else it could be.  I'm 28 weeks.  Did they tell you what too much fluid means besides twins???   I really don't think I"m having twins!As for your question, I really think they would have scene 2 babies.  You've had your BIG u/s right?

i have twins. they caught it at 5 weeks. the heart rates are different every time and don't beat on the same beat.so it's hard to think it is one. also by now you'd be getting kicked all over the place probably. lol. at least thats my experience. :)
I doubt that with todays technology, and 2 u/s, that they would miss twins....inverted uterus or not.  It's a singleton!

Maybe your pregnancy started off as a twin pregnancy and that is why you have a "feeling"? Vanishing twin is common and so is your feeling of having twins. Ask your doc for another US, to ease your mind. At the very least the next time you go and they check for the heartbeat ask them to move the doppler to another part of your belly just for fun to see if there is anything else, that should confirm one way or another!!!

question: Ok I know back in the old days women had twins and didn't know they were having twins till the very end cause of lack of technology and ultrasounds. But do u all think its possible now for them to miss it? It the very beginning my uterus was retroverted and made it hard to see so maybe they could have missed it. Now I'm farther along and my uterus is bigger than its supposed to be and i've got lots of amniotic fluid which i know is all signs of twins. I don't think I have twins, but this nagging thought has been in the back of my mind since the VERY beginning when I was having bad back pain at 7wks which I've heard alot of women say they had with twins. This is my first baby. What do u ladies think?
title: Twins, what do u guys think?
